summary: This document is an email chain from September 2020 between FBI agents discussing the need for approval and cost estimates for international travel to London to interview an important witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation. The travel was originally planned for March 2020 but was postponed due to COVID-19.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: The primary FBI agent from the New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit who is requesting approval and providing a cost estimate for travel to London to interview a witness in the Epstein/Maxwell case.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: An FBI Supervisory Special Agent from the Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit at FBIHQ who is responding to the travel request, providing guidance on approval, and noting an upcoming transition in unit leadership.

connections.description: Professional correspondence regarding approval for international travel for case-related witness interviews, showing a supervisory and operational relationship within the FBI.

events.title: Planned London travel for witness interview
events.description: The FBI agent and two AUSAs from SDNY had planned to travel to London in March 2020 to interview an important witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation, but the trip was canceled due to COVID-19.

events.title: Video call with witness
events.description: The FBI agent spoke briefly via video with the important witness, who expressed discomfort talking at length unless the interview was conducted in person.

events.title: Proposed travel dates to London
events.description: The FBI agent proposes new travel dates from October 12 through October 17, 2020, to conduct the in-person witness interview in London.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively pursuing the Epstein/Maxwell investigation in September 2020, planning international travel to interview an important witness.
An important witness in the case was located in London and was unwilling to speak at length via video, requiring an in-person interview.
The travel was initially planned for March 2020 but was canceled due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
The cost estimate for the trip for two people was $6,179, covering flights, lodging, and other expenses.
Approval for the travel required sign-off from both the division's Special Agent in Charge (SAC) and the International Operations Division (IOD).
